job.name: Mark_To_Future_Cube_Stats

variable.description: The start date of the evalution.
variable.name: evaluation_date_start

variable.description: The end date of the evalution.
variable.name: evaluation_date_end

variable.description: The start of the shocked yield range.
variable.name: shocked_yield_start

variable.description: The end of the shocked yield range.
variable.name: shocked_yield_end

variable.description: The yield step of the shocked yield range.
variable.name: shocked_yield_delta

variable.description: The relative path from the dataspace of the bond params file following the tsv format.
variable.name: bonds_params_file_path_from_dataspace

variable.description: The number of ProActive replicated tasks, each having in charge a cubelet, i.e. a subset of the senarios.
variable.name: nb_replicated_tasks

variable.description: The number of ProActive replicated tasks, each having in charge a cubelet, i.e. a subset of the instruments.
variable.name: nb_replicated_tasks_per_cubelet

variable.description: Exclusive usage or not of the targeted node sources.
variable.name: node_source_compute_memory_intensive_exclusive

variable.description: Name of the targeted node source dedicated to compute intensive tasks.
variable.name: node_source_compute_intensive

variable.description: Name of the targeted node source dedicated to memory intensive tasks.
variable.name: node_source_memory_intensive

variable.description: The path of the output files.
variable.name: data_dir_path

job.description: Estimates a Mark-to-Future cube for bond portfolios. The pricing engine relies on the C++ Quantlib library.

variable.description: The workflow catalog path estimating a cubelet, i.e. a subset of the senarios.
variable.name: called_workflow

script.code:
print("stats_cubelet ...")
# Retrieve variables job_id <- variables["PA_JOB_ID"] task_id <- variables["PA_TASK_REPLICATION"] data_dir_path <- variables["data_dir_path"]
# Read the cubelet csv file MtF_cubelet_file_path <- file.path(data_dir_path, paste("MtF-cubelet_parentjob_", job_id, "_submitter_task_id_", task_id, ".csv", sep='')) MtF_cubelet <- read.table(file=MtF_cubelet_file_path, header=TRUE, sep="\t")
# Compute the portfolios clean prices MtF_cubelet_stats <- aggregate(x= MtF_cubelet$cleanPrice, by=list(MtF_cubelet$evaluationDate, MtF_cubelet$shockedYield), FUN=sum) names(MtF_cubelet_stats) <- c("evaluationDate", "shockedYield", "portfolioCleanPrice")
print(MtF_cubelet_stats)
# Save the results MtF_cubelet_stats_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("MtF_cubelet_stats_job_", job_id, "_task_", task_id, ".csv", sep='')) write.table(MtF_cubelet_stats, file = MtF_cubelet_stats_file_path, row.names=FALSE, sep="\t", append = FALSE)
print("... stats_cubelet")

variable.description: If true, the workflow tasks will be executed inside a docker container
variable.name: DOCKER_ENABLED

script.code:
library("corrplot")
print("stats_cube ...")
# Retrieve variables job_id <- variables["PA_JOB_ID"] nb_replicated_tasks <- as.integer(variables["nb_replicated_tasks"])
# Gather the first cubelet stats and write it to the csv cube file MtF_cubelet_stats <- read.table(file=file.path(localspace, paste("MtF_cubelet_stats_job_", job_id, "_task_0.csv", sep='')), header=TRUE, sep="\t") MtF_cube_stats_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("MtF_cube_stats_job_", job_id, ".csv", sep='')) write.table(MtF_cubelet_stats, file = MtF_cube_stats_file_path, row.names=FALSE, sep="\t", append = FALSE)
# Merge with the other cubelets stats i <- 1 while (i < nb_replicated_tasks) {
# Read the current csv cubelet file MtF_cubelet_stats_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("MtF_cubelet_stats_job_", job_id, "_task_", i, ".csv", sep='')) MtF_cubelet_stats <- read.table(file=MtF_cubelet_stats_file_path, header=TRUE, sep="\t")
# Append it to the csv cube file write.table(MtF_cubelet_stats, file = MtF_cube_stats_file_path, col.names = FALSE, row.names=FALSE, sep="\t", append = TRUE)
i <- i+1 }
# Create a dataframe with ordered ptf values time series for each shockedYield column MtF_cube_stats <- read.table(file=MtF_cube_stats_file_path, header=TRUE, sep="\t") ptf_values_time_series <- data.frame(matrix(0, nrow = length(unique(MtF_cube_stats$evaluationDate)))) shockedYields <- unique(MtF_cube_stats$shockedYield) for (i in shockedYields) { MtF_cube_stats_filtered <- MtF_cube_stats[MtF_cube_stats$shockedYield==i,] MtF_cube_stats_filtered_ordered <- MtF_cube_stats_filtered[order( format( as.Date( MtF_cube_stats_filtered$evaluationDate,"%m/%d/%Y"), format="%Y/%m/%d")),]
ptf_values_time_series <- cbind(ptf_values_time_series, MtF_cube_stats_filtered_ordered$portfolioCleanPrice) } ptf_values_time_series <- ptf_values_time_series[,-1] colnames(ptf_values_time_series) <- shockedYields
print("========ptf_values_time_series=======") print(ptf_values_time_series) print("===============")
# Save the results ptf_values_time_series_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("ptf_values_time_series_job_", job_id, ".csv", sep='')) write.table(ptf_values_time_series, file = ptf_values_time_series_file_path, row.names=FALSE, sep="\t", append = FALSE)
# Compute correlations ptf_values_time_series_corr <- cor(ptf_values_time_series)
print("========ptf_values_time_series_corr=======") print(ptf_values_time_series_corr) print("===============")
# Save the results ptf_values_time_series_corr_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("ptf_values_time_series_corr_job_", job_id, ".csv", sep='')) write.table(ptf_values_time_series_corr, file = ptf_values_time_series_corr_file_path, row.names=FALSE, sep="\t", append = FALSE)
# Plot and Save as png ptf_values_time_series_corr_png_file_path <- file.path(localspace, paste("ptf_values_time_series_corr_job_", job_id, ".png", sep='')) png(height=1200, width=1200, file=ptf_values_time_series_corr_png_file_path) corrplot(ptf_values_time_series_corr, type="upper", order="hclust", tl.col="black", tl.srt=45, is.corr = FALSE) dev.off()
print("... stats_cube")
